results.description:
The International Interior Design Association (IIDA) New York Chapter is a professional networking and educational association of 750+ Members in ten specialty Forums. IIDA NY provides our Members with the resources to reach expertise, knowledge and contacts. Networking and social events allow professionals and industry members to connect on more personal terms that encourage trust, collaboration, and innovation.

Our Chapter is proud to have been recognized as IIDA Large Chapter of the Year in 2011, 2008, 2001 and 2000.

The International Interior Design Association (IIDA) is the Commercial Interior Design Association with a global reach. We support design professionals, industry affiliates, educators, students, firms and their clients through our network of 15,000+ Members across 58 countries. We advocate for advancements in education, design excellence, legislation, leadership, accreditation, and community outreach to increase the value and understanding of Interior Design as a profession that enhances business value and positively impacts the health and well-being of people’s lives every day.

Visit us at http://www.iidany.org

Check out photos from our events: https://www.flickr.com/photos/iidany/
results.name: IIDA NY Chapter Meetup

results.description:
Technical competency and problem solving skills are essential to the success of our children. Many initiatives have been introduced to provide more STEM education; however, the efforts have largely focused on older children, mostly high school and junior high school students. Research suggests that children should be exposed to technology at an earlier age so that it becomes second nature to them. To that end, a new space is under construction to provide hands-on experience in technology to elementary school aged children (pre-K to 5th graders). Children will experiment with technology by building and programming robots, coding with Scratch/Blockly, creating animations and websites, designing circuit-based projects, and much, much more. We anticipate an early spring launch. 

In the meantime, we would welcome any volunteer who is interested in advancing this initiative to please contact us and let us know how you would like to help. We are a nonprofit organization (501(c)3 designation is in the works). We would love to hear from you!
results.name: Kids Technology Lab

results.description:
Ever find your self hunting ANSWERS in the business, psychology or self-help sections of bookstores, ONLINE or doing Yoga? What if you could upgrade your thoughts, feelings,habits and future like the apps on your tablet or smartphone? Are you stuck and can't get your life moving faster. What if there are NEW methods to RESET your life like when your smartphone freezes. "UPGRADE And RESET YOUR LIFE" provides tools that will make you happier, more passionate about life, more productive on your dreams, and wealthier. We will get you to "do life" and not just learn "about" it. You will make discoveries about yourself, stop negative thoughts, develop better habits, evolve beyond your wildest dreams. Each session you will practical cognitive tools to immediately take your life to the next level.
This is Not the lecture format you have seen and done many times in the past, there are better ways to learn and gain rapid results.

                                                  Forming A Community Of Shared "Specific Mind" Practices 

Our mission is to build a wide community of friends, family, and coworkers using New-art and other tools together during meetup sessions and in their daily lives.
What makes this different from anything else in the world, is each member will work on their "Specific Mind." For the first time ever people interested in self-improvement will work on their "Specific Mind" instead of an abstract philosophy of how people should work.
There are tools that can effect both emotions and habits. Like brain mapping you will learn to capture your specific unique mind, take measurements of habits, thoughts and emotions. Place the palm of your hand on your forehead. You are now centimeters form your frontal and prefrontal cortex. This is only one brain system out of the many that produce your unique personality and habits profile. We will take abstract concepts and transform them through the knowledge of neural science and physics into powerful physical tools you can touch. Self directed improvement could be so much more than short-lived inspiration.


                                                        Each SESSION Will Use New Art

A combination of cognitive, Neuro science and visual Art designed to unlock the architecture of your mind hidden within the vast landscape of your brain. New Art will allow each person to understand their own "Specific-Mind" like a MRI for the mind. The primary emphasis of New Art is developing self-awareness and choices. It becomes easy to literally see your limitations and problems while also seeing powerful solutions no other tools can provide. You will enhance the best of yourself while upgrading your life in ways beyond your dreams. Join this group to start UPGRADING YOUR LIFE each week. You will have fun while making real changes in your life. 

Each Session members will hold in their hands printed sheets of Art work they will use to record parts of their minds, solve problems, communicate with their minds (different from meditation), record measurements of mental activity. With the Art Work members of the community will be able to show each others what they are working on each week. Personal improvement moves form a philosophical talk to show me your Art work and what you are working on. Members will select projects and goals they will work on as individuals and within the community making possible everything form habit change, weight release, less stress, greater mental focus, solving business problems, removing fears and anxieties, becoming free from shyness, emotional clarity and more.  


GAIN CLARITY ABOUT WHAT YOU REALLY WANT IN YOUR BUSINESS AND PERSONAL LIFE

MAKE REAL CHANGES TO YOUR THOUGHTS, FEELINGS AND ACTIONS

DISCOVER THE HIDDEN ASSETS NEEDED TO BUILD YOUR FUTURE

TRANSFORM YOUR PAST INTO AN INVALUABLE SOURCE OF NEW POSSIBILITIES

USE YOUR EMOTIONS AS RESOURCES

YOU WILL DISCOVER HOW TO SET AND ACHIEVE GOALS IN THE REAL WORLD

DRAMATICALLY ENHANCE YOUR COMMUNICATION SKILLS

EACH SESSION WILL BE WILL BUILD ON THE LAST AND TAKE TO THE NEXT STEP
results.name: UPGRADE AND RESET YOUR LIFE

Come and enjoy blissful kiirtana and meditation at Ananda Marga Yoga and Meditation Centre, located at 149 02 Melbourne Avenue, Flushing, NY 11367-1356. Ananda Marga Kiirtana is a practice combining the singing of the mantra BABA NAM KEVALAM and dancing the ancient Lalita Marmika dance. This prepares the mind for going deep into meditation. results.description:
"Writers write while dreamers procrastinate."  (Besa Kosova)

This meet-up was formed to help its member stay on the wagon and make blogging way of life.

We meet once a month, and spend the time in our meetings to discuss writing in general and blogging in particular:  writing style, tone, authority, grammar etc. We will also dedicate a lion share of our meetings' time to read and review each others posts and provide constructive feedback. Tips, learning, ideas and suggestions to keep blogging going are always welcome.

While we'll focus mainly on the writing side of blogging, occasionally we'll talk also about other aspects of it, such as tools, and audience development.

Please read before applying:

Our meetings are meant to be and intimate (less than 20 members). Participation and commitment are essential. If what you're looking for is networking, or meeting new people, but you have no intention to write, share your writing and provide feedback to other teammates, then this is probably not the group you're looking for.

********the first meeting is mandatory without a good reason if u miss three meetups u will taken out of the group if u don't have a good reason.

cheers

piper

<br>

"it is a luxury to b understood."----Emerson

<br>

"there are only two ways to live your life: one way is as though nothing is a miracle, the other is as though everything is a miracle."

<br>

"Don't judge somebody, just because they fuck up differently than u."

<br>

this is a support circle for moms in all situations, be it maternity leave, a stay at home mom and whose also new to Montclair, maybe a mom who literally needs a network because they are having a difficult time with post partum depression or even anxiety.  as a friend to many women from my moms group in Hoboken, a mom friend from the mother's center of central new jersey, I know mom friends who are extremely uncomfortable in their shell as a stay at home mom and I know the moms who always wanted to b stay at home moms.   i know moms who love their job and would never give it up even if they hit the lottery.  it doesn't matter if u work and have some time to spend away from your kids, u deserve this group. 

who wouldn't receive more smiles and laughs in their day if they could?   sometimes people even act differently if they are home sweeping and burping a child all day than when they perform at work. there has been studies on it. sometimes isolation occurs not to mention losing yourself in your child. it happens esp if u r a perfectionist like me. 

this is a support group for moms, it can b a networking group for moms, (lots of working full time moms are insecure that they don't know other mom friends.) most importantly id like you to c this as a friendship circle of moms who will know one another for a very very long time.  leave all your biases at the door, and take a rest once a week with us.  lets rest once a week and talk see how many of our lives are surprisingly the same.

cheers

piper

results.description:
WorldChoiceModels is where models take charge and host events for photographers in a variety of themes and locations: Bridal shoots, engagement shoots, portraits, fashion, action, sport, lifestyle, commercial branding, etc. Photographers can also request for themed events. Events are limited to 4 photographers. Most models seem to prefer 3 photographers. Those events with more than 4 are called paparazzi shoot-outs, they typically cost less. Some events are meet and greets or promotional events.

The models chosen to be on the team have been interviewed and have passed a series of criteria to participate. These models are professional and work well beyond the time behind the camera: They scout locations, contact venues, determine if permits are required or not and obtain them if feasible. Some events require they rent wardrobe or equipment and it doesn't need to be explained that there is a great deal of time doing all of that. This group nor the models do any TFPs... Ever. What's nice is the photographers never have to spend any time editing, copying or distributing pictures to models. That's right. Photographers are not obligated to share their pictures nor are the models expecting any from them. WorldChoiceModels is ideal for:

• Photographers that want to do street photography or photowalks with a model. • Photographers looking to practice their skills, experiment with their equipment or technique.

• Photographers looking to expand their portfolios. bridal, senior portraits, couples, fashion, commercial lifestyle, editorial, etc. From time to time there will be workshops on studio lighting, and specific genres. So keep a look out. Hopefully changing the name will attract women photographers ,which I know are many.

This is an excellent forum to practice and build your portfolio. In the next few months you will notice some admin activity and shortly after the models will take charge,

My best to everyone

John Bodensiek
results.name: !! "Brooklyn - New York - Model Events for Photographers"

results.description:
Tribute Strength is a CrossFit gym run & operated by people with similar goals, morals & values. We are genuine people that care. Genuine people with a background in fitness, athletics & coaching. People who respect the process of becoming fit & all the obstacles along the way. We’re people just like anyone else. We have families of our own. We understand that life is a gentle and tricky balance of caring for oneself as well as our loved ones. Far too often the former gets neglected and we can say that because we’ve been there. We’ve been down that road. Ultimately we decided it was time to make time. Time to make fitness a goal and embrace the truth that is the fragility of life. 

CrossFit is defined as, “Constantly varied functional movements performed at relatively high intensity.” It combines cardiovascular endurance, weightlifting & gymnastics to form the foundation of measurable fitness & health. Often performed in a class & teamwork atmosphere, CrossFit prides itself on community. It’s that very community or team that makes working hard fun. The philosophy, in a nutshell, at Tribute Strength is to get ourselves and our members fit, happy and healthy. 

Intrigued? Want to learn more? We welcome you to come into Tribute and have fun, get fit & leave with a smile!


Tribute Strength - CrossFit Woodland Park

20 Andrews Drive - Unit 3, Woodland Park, NJ

www.tributestrength.com

Follow us on Facebook & Instagram!
results.name: Tribute Strength - CrossFit Classes!

results.description: Greetings babysitting swappers and exchangers! Hope this message finds you and your families well! This is a group for families looking for like minded parents to do babysitting swaps/exchanges with and virtually save on all monetary cost associated with child care. Anyone can create meetups and-or post. We have a free conference call line. This group is the resource that you need whether you are an eventful, active, career parent or a hard-working, resilient stay-at-home parent having the time to accomplish task or take time for your self to replenish so that you can be fully available for your family and career is priceless. This group is great for parents who have enough energy reserved to be available for children in addition to their own. Whether it is once a week or more that you do exchanges, this group WILL allow you to save on babysitters and expensive child care cost within a supportive network of families that also provides opportunity to nurture, love and teach each others children. We are parents ourselves and that experience alone can be so significant in having peace on who we are leaving our children with when we do exchanges. We invite all exchangers to meetup at some of the fun, free and low cost events posted in this group when exchanging. This group is founded on the principle that it takes a village to raise our children. In order to participate you mainly need to have enough energy and time reserved to care for children in addition to your own in a loving, safe manner. Homeschool parents, Single parents, Married parents, Foster parents, Aunties and Uncles raising neices and nephews, Grandparents raising grandchildren and more lets greet eachother, meet-up, get to know one another in this co-op to save on day and night care! Share with family, friends and neighbors. The bigger our network is the more resources we have for our families to swap with and even for backup care. <br>Please note that you should be willing to share who you are, your lifestyle, background and personal info as appropriate with the families that you are exchanging babysitting with. We all want to trust, know and feel safe with who are children are left with during an exchange. Discuss who your child is and any rules you want to take place while you are exchanging. Tips and advice will be posted in the group for help on how to safely do exchanges. This group and it's founder are not responsible or liable for any injury, accidents or harm done to your child/children. You MUST get to thoroughly know the familes you are doing exchanges with! Join our yahoo group for more updates, information, free resources and more. Http://groups.yahoo.com/parent_exchange
results.name: Parents Exchange Group

results.description: Hi! My name is Stacy. I grew up in a small town in New Jersey where everyone knew everybody. I dated and married one of my best friends cousins. We had a demolition business together, got married, had a kid. We were together for 15 years. Life presented us with many challenges and ultimately our marriage ended. I went down a spiritual path studying everything from transcendental meditation to Kabbalah. Which led me to move closer to the city. After getting divorced and uprooting my entire life, which included changing careers I found myself in search of like minded people. Thus this Meetup... I'm looking to create something to help those who are in a similar situation and to bring us all together and enjoy our new endeavors in life. I'd like to create social events with single parents and kids, adults only events, and just some good old fashion fun. If you're like me and you want to meet like minded people come try my Meetup and let me know what kinds of things you'll like to do. Xo Stacy P.S. My hot friend Esther who's also divorced but no kids is co-organizer of my new meetup.

-Buddah

We all know the term "Law of Attraction." But, what is it, really? How does it work? And, what practical place does it have in day-to-day life?

The purpose of this group is to answer these questions, as well as bring like-minded people together to form a network of support in living with clear intention. 

You'll learn about the Universal Laws and Abraham Hicks' processes and practices. This will help you shift your energetic vibration, align with your higher self and empower you to deliberately create a life you love.

Coming together as a group to do this type of work is incredibly powerful. This is truly our life's work, and committing to our lives in this way is not only transformational for us. It's transformational for those around us.

This Meetup is for those who love to read fiction novels and are looking for a book discussion group in NYC.

We’ll be meeting up about once a month to share our thoughts about a particular book. It’ll be very low-key and will often take place in venues that follow that book’s theme. Those in their 20s and 30s are preferred. 

We’ll primarily read contemporary fiction novels, but will also occasionally read short story collections, essays, and memoirs. There may also be opportunities to do book and movie discussions, seeing that so many films these days are based on books. Please take a look at our upcoming Meetups! 

Thanks for your consideration, and see you soon! :) 

------

"A story is not like a road to follow…it’s more like a house. You go inside and stay there for a while, wandering back and forth and settling where you like and discovering how the room and corridors relate to each other, how the world outside is altered by being viewed from these windows.” —Alice Munro

topics.name: BNI - Business based on professional relationships

results.description: If you're on meetup.com, chances are you know the importance of networking to generate new business. Networking leads to business referrals which are THE fastest way to grow your business. Over 98% of businesses get business from referrals, yet only 3% of those businesses have a plan to consistently get those referrals. Are you ready to join the 3%? For 30 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain." By helping other members grow their business those same members will in turn help you grow your business. In 2014 BNI members passed 6.6 million referrals that generated an amazing $8.6 billion worth of closed business. Whether you're new to BNI or have some experience, chances are you've never seen anything like Revenue Raisers before. We're 20+ (and counting) highly motivated, enthusiastic and generous professionals that genuinely care about each other and growing each others business from consistent warm referrals. Our members span from fields as diverse as real estate, legal, tech, marketing, finance, and health and wellness. We have power teams that can take you and your business to that next level. Best of all, we only allow one person per profession. If your profession isn't yet represented in our chapter, you could quickly become the go-to guy or gal. Imagine what having 20+ hungry salespeople looking for new business for you around the clock could do for your business. Are you our next success story? RSVP to our next meeting (Tuesdays at 7:00AM at Junior's) and see for yourself how BNI can change your business and your life for the better. Because, who couldn't use a smoking hot referral RIGHT NOW?! Current Location: Junior's 386 Flatbush Ave Ext Brooklyn, NY 11201 Cost: $20/visitor The meeting starts at 7:00am and is officially over at 8:30am. You will need to bring 50+ business cards to pass to everyone in the room. You will also need to be prepared to tell the room who you are, what you do, and who a perfect referral for you would be. The more specific you are in asking for the referral the greater chance you have in receiving that life changing referral on the spot.
results.name: BNI Revenue Raisers, Brooklyn NY

results.description: We are an eclectic community of women whom meet once a month in co-created sacred space to meditate, share, support, and set intentions. This is a place where women can let down their guard, be vulnerable, and speak their truth while being held in a safe space. Circles happen on or near the evening of the new moon because this is the best time, astrologically, to plant seeds for what we long to manifest in our lives and for the world. Setting intentions with a group is a powerful practice because it allows your dreams and longings to be witnessed and supported by others. It also holds you accountable to taking the necessary action, internally and externally, to manifest your longings. While every circle has a different theme, there in always meditation, group sharing (optional), and the writing and speaking of individual intentions. Circles may also incorporate aspects of spiritual ceremony and ritual; however, it is not religious and open to women of all ages, backgrounds, beliefs, and faiths. Allow yourself to be supported by the heavens and held in the energies of the Divine Feminine as you make space for new awareness, transformation, and manifestation.

This new group is for people who work from home, and need to get out of the house more!  Come meet flesh-and-blood real people, who live the way you do!

We will get together now and then for a drink at the end of the day (or breakfast or lunch sometimes).  The idea is to substitute a bit for the camaraderie that our office-based colleagues enjoy during their lunches and TGIFs! 

We hope to make friends and learn from each other about not just business/technology but also politics, culture, or whatever else comes up.  Venues and times will vary according to participant suggestions.

Our definition of "work" is broad.  Examples are: writing/editing; sales/marketing; web/graphic design; software; customer support; nonprofit work; start-up ventures; and so forth.  You could work remotely for an established company, or be a freelancer or solo practitioner.  The common thread is that you spend the day at your desk at home, with just your computer and phone connecting you to other human beings!

Unlike some other meetups, this group has no hidden agenda.  The organizer is not promoting any self-help plan, consulting service, business opportunity, lead-generation system, multi-level-marketing scheme, or girl scout cookies!  Come be comfortable with us; nobody is trying to sell you anything.

results.description:
INTRODUCTION TO EBRU ART ( WATER MARBLING)
EBRU ART (WATER MARBLING);
Ebru’s original name was EBRE in Jagatai dialect and during its journey through Iran via the Silk Road this name was changed into EBRI (cloud-like) then ABRU (face of water). Seljukian and Ottoman periods saw a widespread performance of this art in the Asia Minor with its final name EBRU. Ebru is the only word used today in Turkey.
As the Europeans discovered this art via merchants and pilgrims at the beginning of the 17th century, they called it
TURKISH PAPER and later WATER MARBLING.
EBRU PRACTICE
Traditionally Ebru is done in WATER that has been thickened with the addition of the naturally occurring substance, GUM tragacanth, a special type of glue.
PAINTS obtained form mineral oxides, again another natural product, one mixed with OX-GALL, and then sprinkled over the surface of the water and dispersed with the help of brushes made from rose branches and horse hair.
The design that occurs on the surface of the water can be given form, motifs and flower DESIGNs can be added, and then placing a sheet of PAPER over the design, the design is transferred to the new medium.
results.name: Brooklyn Turkish Cultural Center Ebru Class (Marbling Art)

results.description: Based in New York City, our intent is to be a community where we can learn to love well. We want to make our love specific towards each other, people, the city, and life we encounter everyday. As we learn to live the way of Jesus, we tolerate a fairly high level of theological diversity and struggle, and try not to be easily breakable. We have very little formal organizational structure. We are not formally associated with any denomination, and we admire and owe our existence to many. Our community consists of Lutherans, Catholics, Eastern Orthodox, Seventh-day Adventists, Quakers, Presbyterians, Humanists, Jews, Muslims, and many other forgotten ones. The seed that grew into Citylights faith community was a “seeker space” that met in a church basement during the winter of 2000-2001. The group was comprised of people with various spiritual backgrounds and experiences, and included both people who thought of themselves as Christians and those who didn’t. The shared purpose in coming together was to have a forum where it was safe to ask tough questions about spirituality and discuss possible answers, or open better questions, to be honest about what made sense and what didn’t, and to enjoy the community itself. Out of this group emerged the vision for a faith community that could nourish honesty, creativity, and action, at any stage in their faith journey. During 2001-2002, the core group that began Citylights spent the year studying small-group community dynamics and developing a vision and road map for the future. In the winter of 2003, we launched two small-group communities that met in apartments on a weekday night. The intention was for people to get beyond the four walls of a church building and share real life together, and to reinforce the idea that true community requires regular interaction. In June 2003, Citylights started Saturday gatherings. In the fall of 2003, Citylights developed the vision to be a “community learning to love well.” We believe that this is ultimate goal of being a follower of Jesus Christ. This vision guides both our visible and hidden curriculum. We are attempting to educate ourselves about God, ourselves, “the other,” and all of life, so we can love well. We are activists for responsibility, justice and mercy in our city, because we think that’s an expression of love for our fellow human beings. We love arts. We love to discuss. We love to sing. We love to dance. We love to eat. We want to love well and we believe that you can help us learn to love better! We are children friendly and have regular kids programing.
results.name: Citylights NYC - A Progressive Christian Community

results.description:
International Networking Week® is an initiative of BNI®. International Networking Week® will feature a number of networking events across the world.
The goal of International Networking Week® is to celebrate the key role that networking plays in the development and success of businesses across the world.
Simultaneous events will be held globally to celebrate International Networking Week®.
The focus of these events will be to bring together representatives of government, businesses and the community to network with each other, to understand the concept of good networking and to listen to talks by key networking specialists from across the world. These speakers will offer advice and information on how businesses can grow and succeed through good networking practices.
Invitations to attend are open to the wider business community, members of other networking organisations, students, press representatives and interested parties from all levels of government and business. The purpose of International Networking Week® is to raise the profile of networking in the wider community, recognising it as an essential tool for success in today’s business climate.

results.description:
The young Korean American Network (yKAN) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit, non-partisan organization of 1.5 and 2nd generation Korean-Americans in the New York City area. The organization consists primarily of young professionals from various job industries, as well as academic fields. All members are volunteers who volunteer their time in order to help promote and advance the Korean-American presence in American society. 

To learn more, check out http://ykan.org 

----------------------------------------- 


History: 

The young Korean American Network started in 1989, however was officially inaugurated in August 30, 1990 as a 501(c)(3) non-profit, non-partisan organization. Their first president, Michael Han, was a founding member who sought to create the organization as a response to the lack of a networking hub for the Korean-American community in New York. Since its inauguration, the organization has grown in the past two decades in number with over 5,000 members receiving the organizations newsletters and announcements. 


Mission: 

“…is to elevate Korean-American professionals by fostering educational programs, community service, and networking opportunities. Through these activities yKAN addresses the issues of our community and provides a forum for those who share common experiences and face similar challenges.” 


Objectives: 

- Create a professional network to facilitate the even exchange of ideas and common goals among all Korean American professionals 

- Foster a professional Korean

-American presence in our community by sponsoring educational programs and opportunities 

- Promote social awareness and activism through community service 

- Foster mutual understanding between Korean-Americans and other ethnic groups 

- Promote greater opportunities for the current and future generations of all Korean Americans
results.name: Young Korean American Network (http://ykan.org)

results.description:
What do we all have in common? 

We all share this three-pound organ. It is the palace of intelligence, interpreter of the senses, initiator of body movement, and monitor of behavior. Our brain connects us, yet diversifies us beyond belief. The study of the brain is too vast to not spark curiosity. 


Psychology Lectures

In this group, you will learn about the foundations and extensions of behavioral neuroscience, social cognitive development, mental illnesses, treatments and much, much more. There is no cap to what you will learn in this group. 

Our lecturers are experienced psychologists, social workers, and academic professors. Not only will we have lectures, but we will also have workshops allowing you to socialize and network with like-minded individuals. 


Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD) as an Initial Focus

We have to start somewhere. Our initial one or two lectures will be about OCD.  Whether you have been suffering from Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD) for years/have a family member suffering or you are just curious about it, join this group. You will learn about the foundations of OCD in terms of research, experiences and treatments from people who actually work in the field ranging from licensed social workers to PhDs.

results.description: This meetup is to empower women (goddesses) to create confidence and awareness around dating. We all have patterns and behaviors that enhance or sabotage our experiences based on our programming, self-perception and attitude. Certain things also influence our experiences such as our nature as women, the nature of men and of course our culture. French Roast or Martini is designed to casually explore and chat about your experiences and offer our perspectives from many years of education, research and practical application. We are objective and loving, supportive and tough. If you are stuck in a dating rut, not sure why, not getting good advice from your friends or family and looking for someone to give you a raw, honest assessment of your role in your dating life, then this meetup is for you. Let's meet up over French Roast or Martinis!

results.description:
The purpose of this group is to provide an opportunity for a small group of gay guys from the New York City area to get together, socialize and connect with one another. Activities will include movie night, drawing group, board game night, pot luck dinners and the like. Most of these activities will be conducted in the comfortable setting of my apartment in queens.

This meetup is meant to be a fun, positive, drama-free environment for a small group of gay guys who enjoy hanging out together. It will be a way to meet with others from different backgrounds and share our unique life experiences. <br> <br>

We hope to inspire and learn from one another, and have some fun while making hopefully making long lasting friendships and relationships. Join us if you are interested in meeting new people, making new friends, and having fun. <br>

Attendance will be capped at 7 guys since it will take place at my apartment. 

Please note that I do have a cat named Chewy who also looks forward to meeting you.

<br>

To maintain the group, please respect a few guidelines: 

1) If you want to join the group, please include an actual picture of yourself in your profile and answer the group questions

2) Please keep your RSVPs updated. If your plans change and you can't make it, let us know.  If you have a habit of RSVPing and not showing up with less than 24 notice, you may be dropped from the group. This keeps it fair when we have limited spots to events.

3) When meetups are at my apartment, please be respectful of the space. 


Quote to think about: “Imagine what it would be like to live in a world where you are more concerned about what you have to offer than what you have to hide.” ~Unknown


Directions: 7 train to 90 st. station

Exiting  the train, walk to the left and then, make a right onto 89th street. You will walk straight down 89th street past four avenues until you reach Northern boulevard. 

As you keep walking on 89th street, you will pass a red Santander bank. My place is across the street from a small park on 89th street.

**Please note it is a 10 minute walk in total to my place.  
Please note I do have a cat named Chewy who looks forward to meeting you.

Buzzer 23

Take elevator to 5th floor. Make a right through the grey fire door and walk to the end of the hall to apartment 510. 

There are other ways to get to my place but I think this is the simplest since you only take the 7 train and walk straight down 89th street to my apartment.
results.name: Gay Guys Group

results.description: Always fascinated by geopolitics, structured analysis, or Homeland? Can't join the CIA? Well then come play analyst with us. We'll read biographies, histories, textbooks, and current events; we'll do case studies, maybe even competitively; we'll even make some apps! Learning how to fire a late 19th century rifle and pretend to get shot by the same is great, but here's an armchair hobby that I expect will help you to be a better, less biased, and more up-to-date thinker in all reaches of your life. So come one, come all, come get your latent inner Foreign Affairs nerd on at A.I.A.
results.name: New York Armchair Intelligence Analysis Meetup

results.description:
We'll get together once a month, and at a certain point, ramp it up a bit, once every 2 weeks, or even weekly to divvy up fresh, home-cooked meals we make at home to save money and eat healthier. I myself often lack the focus, energy, time and motivation to cook healthy, wholesome meals, even though I have tons of cookbooks and know how to. Being single can do that to you, and it's not good for my waistline or my budget. We can meetup at my place (I have a large dining room and kitchen) and divide whatever meals people bring into tupperwares, taking home nice portions to eat through-out the week. One of the main reasons I don't like cooking as a single woman is leftovers... I'm not a fan... so this kind of takes care of that problem. Instead of eating the same meal 7 nights in a row, we can have 7 or more people come and eat a different meal each night of the week! My apartment has a very spacious living room, dining room and kitchen. It's best we prepare food at our own places, but if needed, we can do some meal prep at my place too. I have a slow cooker, rice cooker, deep fryer and every other cooking gadget imaginable. I'm no longer a vegetarian, so I'm open to meals of any kind. Healthy is nice though. Casseroles and one pot meals are great. We'll balance it out when we see what people plan to bring. 

Maybe we can kick back and have a few drinks too. I have a nice big patio/2nd flr. Balcony with a grill, seats, a table, etc, nice view of trees,  perfect for chilling out on.
results.name: NYC Meal Swap Group

Empowered Hypnosis Wellness Centers are the World’s Leading Centers for Hypnosis and Reiki Therapies. Your Team for Success Started in 2008 Empowered Hypnosis Wellness Centers were designed to provide busy New York City clients a place to discover their own mind powers. Using a holistic approach that includes Hypnosis, Reiki Healing and Life Coaching Therapy, Empowered Hypnosis Wellness Centers help clients tap into their own Creative Self to solve life’s problems and achieve all their hopes and dreams. For more than 7 years, Empowered Hypnosis Wellness Centers’ specialists have worked with over 10,000 people to achieve balance, harmony and incredible personal power through the tools the Centers’ professionals provide. Physical Wellness – Using the non-invasive power of Reiki Healing Therapy, the specialists at Empowered Hypnosis Wellness Centers help their clients achieve energy balance and show them how to tap into the immense power that is their physical body. Subconscious Empowerment – Through Empowered Hypnosis, they are able to help clients use their subconscious mind, which represents up to 90% of their brains’ power, to solve problems and create immense personal success and satisfaction. Life Coaching – Using the conscious mind to guide their clients’ lives, the therapists at Empowered Hypnosis Wellness Centers gently lead their clients to their personal, professional and spiritual goals. Balance – Balancing energies and life’s focuses are the key to personal health, satisfaction and success. Empowerment – Inside each of us lies the potential for massive success; our job is to tap into that together. Direction – Partnering with our specialists, you will be able to give your passions and goals structure and a path to fruition. Compassion – While change can be difficult, we are there to support and guide you with loving kindness. Wellness – Mental and physical health are the foundation upon which your success is built. Contact us today for a FREE consultation 212-851-6851! www.empoweredhypnosis.com

results.description:
Flat Earth New Jersey is for the critical thinker who has come to the realization that the planet they are living on is not a sphere, but a flat plane extending outward in all directions past Antarctica as far as the eye can see and quite possibly, much, much further...Above our heads, both the sun and the moon travel parallel to the ground in a spiral like pattern , making their way towards the outer edge then back again forming what we as seasons.

this group will serve as platform for people to discuss Flat Earth Theory, The implications and changes that might take place in the near future and how they will affect our immediate society. I would encourage outspokenness regarding this topic and an effort on the members part to promote this idea respectfully and truthfully.

The world needs to wake up to the mother of all conspiracy theories...

This group doesn't need street corner preachers. The presence of this meet up in a social setting can act as a conversation starter. These facts represented rationally and respectfully will prove to be the ace in hole that just might lift us all to a higher state of consciousness.

This is not a new religion or a cult. This group answers to nobody. No information moves forward unless substantiated by fact and is repeatable in accordance with proper scientific method.
results.name: Flat Earth New Jersey

We offer a form of Buddhist practice based on the Lotus Sutra and the teachings of the 12th century monk Nichiren Shonin. We are the orthodox school practicing Mahayana Buddhism based on the Lotus Sutra. We also offer meditation, study of the Lotus Sutra, study of Nichiren Shonin's writings and sutra chanting practices. We are known as the noisy Buddhists because of our intense, percussive manner of chanting. All are welcome, no experience necessary--come join our weekly services.

results.description:
It's not everyday that you hear about "Death Cafés." So, what in the world is it? "Death Cafés are part of a global movement, to increase awareness about death with a view of helping people make more of their (finite) lives. We gather in a safe, relaxed setting to discuss death, celebrate life, and drink tea (or coffee), and eat delicious cake together. Not morbid at all! 

Death Café was started in 2011 by Jon Underwood and based on the work of Swiss sociologist Bernard Crettaz. Bernard offered "Café Mortels" in Switzerland and France. Jon read of this in a newspaper article in November 2010. Jon was already developing a project to get people talking about death and immediately knew that Bernard’s vision clicked with his. Fast forward to July 2012, when Lizzy Miles brought Death Café to the US in Columbus, Ohio. Today there are more than 2600 Death Cafés held globally…won't you be part of this growing movement? Our Death Café welcomes, and is open to the community. We have no intention of leading people to any conclusion, product or course of action…just deep conversation and cake! 

There is limited seating so please RSVP. Good-will donations are encouraged and accepted for space rental. Staten Island's Death Café is held the first Sunday of every month from 2 - 4pm. Hope to see you there!
results.name: Staten Island's Death Café

北美华人科技工商联合会是北美规模最大的学界/工商界社团/组织之一。由北美知名高校、科研机构及知名企业的在校学生、在职人士及企业家校友组成。自成立以来，为北美地区各级政府、企业、高校举办过数十场大型人才招聘会/招财引智洽谈会，筹备了数十余场国际上具备一定影响力的科技，金融高端峰会，应邀嘉宾来自美国主流社会以及国内政商学界精英1000多人次。在芝加哥，硅谷，纽约，华盛顿，波士顿，温哥华，慕尼黑，特拉维夫全球各地进行各个领域的专业培训。多年来安排访问交流人数近3000余人。出席活动嘉宾包括美国前国务卿鲍威尔，澳大利亚前总理陆克文等世界名流。常年策划大型新年，元宵，国庆晚会，历届晚会皆有近1200人参加。并在2014年成功筹备中美建交35周年大型文艺晚会的杰出工作获得了国务院侨办等众多机构的贺函。

results.description:
Hi there, This group is open to all homeschoolers and anyone interested in homeschooling. I started this group to establish a gathering that caters to raising godly children. It is so important for us to learn, teach, and demonstrate virtues (moral excellence) to our little ones. Meet-ups involve one or more of the following:  prayer, bible reading/teaching, goal-setting for our children, teaching colors, numbers, ABC's, teaching textures, shapes, and sizes, scripture memory, outdoor exploring, learning through nature, arts and crafts, health and fitness introduction, library meet-ups, discussions. My hope is to unite people committed to raising godly children, and for us to all grow as we seek direction from God. Let us get together and see what the Lord has in store. 

You are especially welcome to this group if you have realized that parenting is more than you can handle on your own.  You are especially welcome to this group If you have some relational issues that have not been resolved and you know it is affecting your parenting.  You are especially welcome if you don't know where you stand with God.  Everyone is in a different place in life and God knows it already.  

There will be many resources shared during our meet-ups to coach us and help us along the parenting journey.  So come on in and stay awhile.
results.name: Yonkers Homeschooling Meetup

results.description:

* Why should members join: All our meetups with have talks focused on a new and changing subjects from meeting to meeting. They will start with a networking event and followed by a discussion and more networking session. One is expected to learn more and also meet interesting people at these events.

* What can members expect out of the group: The group will probably meet once a month for 2 hours in a professional event space. We expect all events to be free at this time and to have at least beer provided.

* Community: Each meeting will start with a 30 minutes networking part followed by 2 or 3 10-minutes talks and finish with another 30 minutes or more of networking and probably debate.

* Who are we ? We are a group of executives in the p2p , online and marketplace lending involved in the new Fintech wave. 

*Why are we doing this ? We all believe that p2p lending and marketplace lending will revolutionize the access of capital for everybody and that a lot is left to be built. Therefore we also believe that the industry as a whole will benefit from an exchange of information and ideas.

We share ideas, help, ressources, introductions , information and more...
results.name: P2P and Marketplace Lending Operators

results.description:
We almost gave up on church. Seriously. And we are clergy people. We were weary of "church as usual." It didn't feel authentic or honest.  Tired of wearing our Sunday best and praying prayers with words we wouldn't normally use, we began to think Jesus is more concerned with how we care for the poor and the marginalized than if we "worship" in a certain way. We had a lot of reservations about the Church.

However, there are some good church people out there. And some of these people said to us, "Well then start something you'd like to be part of!" And so, here we are, trying to start something that we want to be part of!  Something new.  Something fresh.  Something different from "church as usual."

This meet up is for people who are tired of playing church. We aren't looking for a new program, model, or style. We are wrestling with a fundamental shift in how we view our mission as Christ followers and how we live that out in our city. We are those who have walked away from church because we feel that "going to church" is just not the most faithful way to follow Jesus. We have questions. We are messy and imperfect and yet we believe the mess is what makes us beautiful and interesting.  We aren't necessarily looking for answers but for those who will accompany us on this journey. 

You are invited to join our conversation.  Whether you are still connected to a particular religious tradition, have walked away from religion altogether, are spiritual but not religious, are questioning, or simply want an imperfect community of people who will care for and challenge you to be open to God, you are invited.
results.name: Nones and Dones of Long Beach, NY

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xqnsbz0cdmo

Being an entrepreneur can be equal parts reward and equal parts frustration. For every triumph and accomplishment, there are times when you wonder if you made the right decision in striking out on your own.  

She's Got S.W.A.G. is a group that recognizes the ups and downs that women entrepreneurs face and provides support, resources, tools, tips, coaching and accountability to assist you in your journey. We recognize the power in collaboration and provide a forum for women entrepreneurs to learn together as they grow their businesses. The goal of She's Got S.W.A.G. is to provide a safe place to discuss and share accomplishments, challenges and solutions. 

Why Join Us...

• You’ve been to countless workshops, conferences and seminars, but don’t understand what to do next.

• You’ve worked with a coach or consultant to map out a plan, but you can’t seem to stay on track.

• You understand that things in your life and/or business NEED to change, but you keep starting over.

You genuinely WANT to do things differently and better, but you can’t seem to stay motivated.

• You have all of the tips, strategies, information and know-how at your fingertips but you’re STUCK!

If any of these (or frankly all of these) statements apply to you, then it’s time for you to stop spinning your wheels and get on track with S.W.A.G.

Documents, Files, Worksheets, Checklists, eBooks and more! Check back often as we're always adding more great content just for you.

FREE Resources: http://www.meetup.com/shesgotswag/files/

We're always adding to the list to help you build and grow your business. (You must be a member of this Meetup group to gain access to the downloads.)

Success Store: Everything you need to run a successful business. Open to all. http://www.meetup.com/shesgotswag/messages/boards/forum/20891705

Interested in joining the Leadership team?

We are looking for people with the time, drive and skills to guide She's Got S.W.A.G.'s growth as a network. Leadership Team members are responsible for developing S.W.A.G. in a way that helps accomplish our mission: 

...to see women stand together and support each other, collaborate and build successful businesses and enterprises in a spirit of cooperation and collaboration--not competition.  There are no cliques, no tiers, no separations between the novice and the expert.  Everyone is a diamond—some of us may shine a bit more brightly, but we’re all here to polish each other so that we can all shine both collectively and individually. 

Serving on the S.W.A.G. Leadership Team is a fantastic opportunity to put your skills to use and take your involvement with S.W.A.G. to the next level as we build the systems and capacity of our network. It's also a great way to focus on your own professional development by meeting new people, enhancing your leadership skills and expanding your network.

Interested in joining the S.W.A.G. Leadership Team? Click here to send a message via Meetup to LaTanya today!
results.name: She's Got S.W.A.G. | Smart Women Accountability Group

results.description:
Fun? During divorce? It isn't just possible — it's necessary!

We are striving to be a vital, active, and top-notch community of single parents and divorcees of Indian origin (anybody belonging to Indian Sub-continent) in the quad-state area of CT, NY, NJ, and PA . This group was started by few who are in similar situation, somehow crossed their paths, and subsequently became good friends and who are also very passionate about providing a low pressure way to connect with other single parents and divorcees on movies, recitals, hikes, festivals, kids activities, happy hours, dinners out, lunches, pot-lucks, picnics, social activities, fun events and more. Although, we are a small group but we want to have an organic growth only with like minded people.


Divorce is hard and solo parenting is not easy either. The mission of this group is to get divorcees, single parents and children out interacting with each other for fun, humor, laughs, camaraderie, support and friendship, and to enhance lives in the process. Few members that we have, often describe that the relationships forged in this group are often deep and rich. This is true of the friendships our kids would make with other kids in the group as well as the relationships their parents form. Most members describe the group as “family.” 

We try to run this group in a very professional, non-judgmental (“Don’t judge others because they sin differently than you do.”), and impartial manner (avoiding conflict of interest, if any) – “Nirbhay Nirvaer”. It is extremely important to maintain high degree of integrity and respect for each other. We expect that members will follow through on their commitments to attend an event when they RSVP “Yes.” Chronic no-shows or late cancellations may result in removal from the group. We also have a WhatsApp chat for people to connect in real-time. Please contact us if you want to be a member of WhatsApp chat(1-917-825-3695/1-609-354-8080).

We all know the trials and tribulations of single parents and divorcees. We provide a unique and amazing opportunity for support and friendship. It is only possible by the efforts of the all-volunteer organizers and event hosts. Please show your appreciation to our volunteers who put out the time, effort (and sometimes their own money) to organize and host wonderful events, and come up with amazing ideas to post these events. Sometimes a simple thank-you can make the effort worthwhile.

We’d love for you to host an event, too! If you would like to host an event, please contact us to indicate that you are interested in becoming an event organizer of the group. Once you are made an event-organizer, you can then create your own events without asking anyone to create one for you.

Thank you so much for joining now your group :). We’re so much looking forward to meeting you.

PS

This is not a “singles” dating group.  While we do not discourage dating in the group, our focus is on activities and events that foster friendships and support for the parents and kids in our group. While don’t police or baby-sit our WhatsApp chat, please refrain from obscenity, cussing, and porn on WhatsApp chat and be respectful to other members. Also, we do not allow former partners of existing members to join the group. This is open only to people of Indian sub-continent origin. Your participation in this group and at event(s) is at the discretion of the organizer(s).
results.name: Divorced Desi's

results.description:
Radical Feminists of New York is a women-only MeetUp group dedicated to the eradication of patriarchy and the abolition of gender. Its members are female-bodied individuals who have either a working knowledge of radical feminist thought or a sincere interest in learning about it. We do not discuss or debate the merits of liberal feminism - we are firmly committed to a radical feminist agenda and believe that discussing liberal feminism is a distraction. We are committed to ending patriarchy, not in achieving “equality” within patriarchy. We are committed to the liberation of all women, of all races and ethnicities, globally, and do not support causes that seek to benefit only white women.

The establishment of this MeetUp group as a women-only space ensures that women in our organization have a liberatory space to work, organize, and bond, free from the negative impact of men. All oppressed peoples need their own space to feel some moments of freedom, create community, and overcome submissive and self-hating behavior. All oppressed peoples have a right to draw a boundary, including women. We are committed to defending the right of women to define our own space
results.name: Radical Feminists of New York

results.description:
Are you less happy when you don't ride your bike? Do you like the way the bike responds to your every move? Do you want to go fast? Far? Both? Are the streets of New York your playground? If so, you have found your crew.

This group is intended primarily for riders of fixed gear and single speed freewheel bikes, but if you love your geared bike and like our rides, you are  welcome. The focus on fixed will manifest in the group in at least these ways:

I will share my own enjoyment of riding fixed.
Many of the rides I choose are, for me, more fun fixed.

Expanding on that last point, we'll do lots of rides that are fun however you do it (riding up to Nyack, through the Hudson Highlands, out to the beach, etc), but some that may seem questionable. For example, "Let's Play in Traffic" is specifically fun for me on a fixed gear because it requires some different handling skills. Exercising and growing those skills is one of the goals and may not sound fun otherwise (or maybe it does!). The probably less questionable "3 Boro 5 Bridge Bike Tour" is fun becase bridges are cool, they offer nice ride-by views of the city, and because on 1 gear it will build more leg strength compared to dropping gears.
In all cases though, if you like biking in the city any of these rides will be fun because you're riding and because you'll increase your knowledge of navigating the city.

Let's meetup and ride!
results.name: Fixed Fury

results.description: Do you have a vlogging channel on YouTube and want to meet other people in NYC that also vlog? Then join this group!

results.description:
Everyone has a story worth telling, sharing. <br>'Let's Talk, New York' is a group of single people, ages 50+ who enjoy having dinner and activities together over good conversation. Being in New York, the opportunity to dine at every place from diners to commercial restaurants to high end eateries, and activities from street fairs to theatre, etc. <br>Every couple of weeks, an event and/or dinner at various places will be scheduled. <br>Always with the opportunity to "talk" and meet new friends and reconnect with friends we met before.

The power of conversations can change us, as we hear new ideas, thoughts, and experiences. Listening is key. <br>Our events include things worth talking about, as we share a meal and/or event together. We will be sure to make the time to talk.

HOW TO ATTEND <br>We find--suggestions always welcome--reasonably-priced restaurants, events and schedule a dinner for our group. We must schedule only for those who RSVP (usually for a Friday or Saturday night) <br>Once an event has been scheduled, you will need to RSVP "yes" or "no". <br>If you RSVP "yes" a $5 or more (if the event has a fee, i.e. Theatre group price) fee is required to reserve your place or event, and help alleviate my costs for the group or room rentals for some fun activities. <br> Our 'Let's Talk, New York' group is successful because people like you, show up on the night, and make it an enjoyable time.

WHO CAN BE A MEMBER? <br>The group is open to anyone aged 50+ who is single, and enjoys great company. Whether you are new in the city or have lived here all your life - I hope you can join us. Listening, talking, questioning, and sharing ideas is at the heart of friendships. We may not always agree, but hopefully each meet-up will give us a new perspective, and broaden our network of friends.

AT THE DINNER EVENT

Please arrive a little earlier than the scheduled time, so we can all be seated on time. You are responsible for the cost of your own food, drink and tip during the dinner.

Open to ideas, as well, for possible activities we can all get involved in; i.e. Tarot/Archangel Card Readings, attending street fairs (as a group), events, group past life regression (my speciality), photography days (with a professional teacher to guide us), tours of our beloved city, shows, movies and other fun activity plus discussion after!

Please bring cash only and pay me when the check comes.

Let's Talk, New York is about good food, great company, and interesting ideas.

You are assured of a warm welcome!
results.name: 'Let's Talk, New York' - Activities & Conversation - 50+

results.description:
The purpose of this group is to serve as an inspiration and motivational hub for women who want to be healthy in the Edison, NJ area. We have regular meetups and hope to meet all of you in person!

This is NOT a BeachBody, Herbalife, Advocare, ItWorks, Plexus etc group. We are here to help women reach their goals, if you use those things great but please don't push them on everyone else. This group is not to be used to personally grow your business or advertise. Doing so will result in immediate removal from the group.

We are based off of Maria Kang and her No Excuse Program. For more info please visit her website: www.mariakang.com

We encourage a healthy lifestyle approach to fitness. There is no quick fix, no one-size-fits-all approach. We do not endorse any specific products, only clean eating in moderation, enough workouts to challenge your body and finding a balance in your personal life that is sustainable over the long haul.

results.description:
Hi, my name is Renat. I started this meetup group because I want to help OpenAI fulfill its mission (I’m not affiliated with the OpenAI non-profit organization). When I was in college, the world of artificial intelligence fascinated me. So I was applying Neural Nets to data sets generated by e-commerce websites (using Kohonen’s Self Organizing Maps).

It was 1999. Looking back, I realize that my research is a joke compared to what you can do today.

What becomes possible tomorrow is super exciting and scary at the same time. That is why I decided to contribute my time and evangelize importance of this non-profit organization among artificial intelligence enthusiasts in New York. Specifically, I will be finding and securing physical locations where members of this group could meet in person, share and discuss ideas.

If you care to help - drop me a line with any ideas or suggestions you might have. Or simply say hello and introduce yourself because I would like to learn about you and the projects you are working on! See you soon!

Disclaimer: This Meetup group is not affiliated with the OpenAI non-profit organization. This Meetup group does not own the OpenAI trademark; this Meetup has no affiliation, connection or association with such third party; Such third party has not approved nor sponsored this Meetup group's use of the trademark in any way.
results.name: OpenAI New York

results.description:
Ever felt you could use a boost of energy or a lucky break so your life can take off to the next level? 

*****Set Goals, connect/network with movers & shakers & learn the secrets to actualizing your dreams?

Are you ready to make 2016 your best year yet?  Do you have goals, dreams, or a business you’d like to start in this next year?

Ever dream of living a more passionate, amazing life but feel challenged on how to change or what to do?

Ever felt stuck, demotivated, or like your life is going in circles?

If you answered yes to any or all of the above questions then this group is definitely for you!

I decided to start this group because I, at a point in my life felt stuck, like life was just passing by & my goals & dreams were just not happening fast enough.

The purpose of this group is to create a structured, positive environment to allow people to share & express their goals & dreams while they get the support & mentoring they need to make them happen!

Participants will understand the mystery of why we feel stuck or not as motivated sometimes & how to literally dissolve these feelings & harness our inner mind powers to achieve our goals & live our dreams!

Throughout these meet ups we'll all have the opportunity to learn in a like minded community where I'll be teaching the inside secrets and where you'll become aware of the most amazing discovery.

You'll learn why you're currently feeling the way you do & how you literally have the power to activate your inner powers to support your dream life. You'll literally see instant results from this new awareness, & the amazing techniques, tools, and processes…

You’ll have the opportunity to practice in our group & outside be in touch within the community.

What gives me the right? I've spent thousands of hours studying, mastering, coaching, & helping others reach their dreams & achieve their goals even when they felt hopeless in doing so. I finally have put together some of the most powerful life changing material that I found creates the biggest difference in one's life while the results can be seen instantly!

Are you ready to learn the most amazing, powerful secrets to attracting your dream & achieving your goals? Are you ready to make 2015 your best year yet?  Do you deserve a dream life full of inspiration, laughter, passion, & positive, lasting connections in your life? Aren't you worth it?

Attending this meetup could seriously & possibly be the best decision you've ever made in your life! I'm SO excited to share these life changing secrets and look forward to meeting all who attend.

Matthew Croteau
results.name: New York Goal Setting Meetup

results.description:
Have you had a dream of running your own business with passion & purpose?

Have you ever felt unappreciated, underpaid or even worse not enjoying going to work?

Have you ever felt fearful financially or emotionally when thinking on you need to make a change but feel trapped & don't know how?

Have you ever dreamed of having a better life, full of excitment, purpose, & a knowing that your adding value to the world & getting paid really well for it, making a 6 or 7 digit annual salary doing what you're passionate about?

If you answered yes to any of the above questions then this group is definitely for you!

I decided to start this group because as a coach, seminar leader, and successful entrepreneur I noticed so many people including myself at a point in time struggle financially & emotionally knowing where we work is not who we are.

The purpose of this group is to ignite passion & hope, inspire & support members to create & share there dreams on paper so they know the direction they'd like to go as well as how to proceed.

You'll become aware of the freedom on SO many levels that you can create when you begin to focus your energies on your dream.  You'll have the support from myself & the amazing team of members that want to succeed with you!

Throughout these Meetups I'll be teaching you the processes on how to begin your business without any risk. You'll learn the amazing techniques, tools, and processes to build momentum & desire.

What gives me the right?  I, who at one time was borderline bankrupt, a financial mess, miserable, & hopeless that I'd ever be able to change, am now living a life I once only dreamed of! From building companies from scratch, selling them for hundreds of thousands of dollars, to retiring in my twenties, to becoming a millionaire, & failing more than most people would probably ever admit, I can't wait to share the secrets I've learned over the years.

Are you ready to decide once in for all that you deserve more.  Are you ready to learn & implement these amazing concepts into your life so you too can be on the road to freedom? Aren't you worth it?

Attending this meetup could seriously & possibly be the best decision you've ever made in your life! I'm SO excited to mentor & facilitate sharing amongst each other in this amazing group.

Matthew Croteau

results.description:
YANASISTERS was created as a way for women to engage in transparent discussions about life, love, and everything in between; while making new friends and engaging in different activities.  The Atlanta YANASISTERS began in 2013 and now has over 2200 members, so this year we're expanding to NY, Chicago, Houston, Jacksonville, and Dallas!

Beginning July 2016, this group will offer events in the NY area, retreats at least annually, and periodic opportunities for group travel abroad.  If you are looking for something different, join us!  All women are welcome into the sisterhood, as long as you come with an open mind and heart. 

Check out www.yanasisters.com for more details and for other ways to stay connected with members of this group, as well as YANASISTERS in other cities across the globe.

For those who are good without a god. Some Humanists are atheists, some are agnostic, but overall we feel man created god and it's not necessary to believe in supernatural beings. God didn't make man; man made gods.

This network is for those who stand behind values above beliefs. Anyone with a positive or curious attitude is welcome to join.

Exploring Humanism

Meetups shall consist of Humanist reading material, personal testimonies, interviews, friendly debates, etc. 

“Even if things don't unfold the way you expected, don't be disheartened or give up. One who continues to advance will win in the end.” 

“I am a humanist, which means, in part, that I have tried to behave decently without expectations of rewards or punishments after I am dead.”

results.description:
Who We Are

Maasai Mamas of Bedford-Stuyvesant is a Mother's group committed to building community with like-minded mothers who believe in advocacy on behalf of children.  

We aim to raise our children in a community of activists where we promote the principles of humanity and compassion through grassroots organizing, play dates, community events and fellowship.

Why Maasai Mamas?

We call ourselves, Maasai Mamas, in honor of the mighty warriors of the Maasai tribe of Africa. The Maasai are known for their remarkable accomplishments but are particularly noted for their highly feared and intelligent warrior class. Surprisingly enough, the traditional greeting passed between Maasai warriors is "Kasserian ingera" which translates to mean "and how are the children?"


How are the children?


How are the children? 


The renowned warriors of the Maasai tribe's first order of business are the children. The proper response (whether a parent of not) is "all the children are well." 


But all the children are not well and therefore #TheMaasaiMamasAreComing. 


Personal Reflections

One thing I have learned on my motherhood journey, is that there isn't a force in this World that is more determined and/or powerful than a mother who is protecting her young. Maasai Mamas of Bedford-Stuyvesant is a Mother's group committed to building community with like-minded mothers who believe in social justice and want to raise their children amongst a community of social activists.


The Birth of Maasai Mamas of Bedford-Stuyvesant 

My first time hearing the Maasai greeting was on the Alex Haley Farm in Clinton, TN during the Children's Defense Fund's annual Ella Baker Child Policy Training Institute. Every year, Freedom School leaders, servant leader interns, educators, Ella Baker Trainers, and community partners gather on the Alex Haley Farm, under the phenomenal leadership of Marian Wright Edelman to learn and study how to organize and advocate on behalf of children. We self-identify as #ChildDefenders...and that is exactly who we are and what we do! 

My first year on the farm I was 6 months pregnant. That was the same summer the Trayvon Martin verdict was announced. I felt hopeless, emotional and unable to advocate and defend my people because at that time, I was carrying my daughter and it was too risky to participate in the national protest and demonstrations that were taking place across the country. 

I had to change my "activism" strategy. 

During the following summer, Michael Brown was gunned down with his hands in the air...my daughter was an infant. Still not able to protest and demonstrate the way I wanted. I organized a mother's group in Baltimore, MD had over 100 mothers, but could not effectively leverage meet-ups around social-action. 

I had to change the strategy. 

This spring (in my daughter's birthplace, Baltimore, MD), Freddie Gray was murdered. Baltimore was burning as I was driving to Brooklyn, NY for a job interview. My phone was ringing off the chart with people asking me if my daughter and I were okay, asking for first hand accounts of what was happening in Baltimore...meanwhile I am driving up I-95, CRYING...still trying to figure out my place in this movement as both a mother and community activist. 

And thus...Maasai Mamas of Bedford-Stuyvesant was born.
results.name: Maasai Mamas of Bedford-Stuyvesant

results.description:
Radical Feminist Activists Meetup Group (RadFem) was founded in 2011 and has hosted almost 200 Meetups of all sorts and had garnered more that 550 supporters. In an inexplicable act of sabotage, a previous organizer shut it down on New Year's Day 2016 (despite a stated pledge not to do so), thereby wiping out all files, studies, reports, photos, discussions, e-lists and the entire institutional memory of the group. This represented the collective product of many feminists over numerous years.

This valuable resource was created for the benefit of, and was open to, the entire Feminist community, members and non-members alike. It will take some time, but we will rebuild both the site and the collective inclusive spirit of the group. Silence in not an option.

Please be a feminist or open to feminism if you join. There are plenty of other groups to join if you are neither. Beyond that, we welcome feminists of all stripes, colors, creeds, and gender identities who are committed to challenging, confronting, and ultimately dismantling Patriarchy. Together we hope to forge a path to sexual equality and gender justice for all, not just by talking amongst ourselves, but by speaking out, writing, marching, demonstrating, protesting and actively projecting a loud and fierce voice in opposition to Rape Culture and the War on Women.

Male supremacy must end. Oppression and violence is not natural or inevitable. Neither is patriarchy or any other kind of kyriarchy (any collection of interlocking and intersecting systems of oppression). Radical Feminism, in the truest sense of the word 'Radical', is about going to the root of the systems of oppression that we all participate in and perpetuate, creating change from the ground up and making the world a better,  more equitable, non-oppressive place.

We believe change is not only possible but probable and above all necessary. Radical Feminist Activists is a place for Radical Feminists to gather, consciousness raise, get creative, share stories, and engage in activism in New York City and beyond. Please join us in this struggle.

Issues we care about (not exhaustive):

- Men's violence against women
- Domestic violence
- Rape and sexual abuse
- Sex trafficking
- Childhood sexual abuse (CSA)
- Racism
- The wage gap and the glass ceiling
- Sexual harassment and stalking
- Homophobia, transphobia, and violence against lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and sex/gender nonconforming people
- Femicide 
- Pornography
- Prostitution and sex work (discrimination against sex workers by choice as well as sexual slavery)
- Sex/gender roles and stereotypes
- Sexism in media and advertising

Join us to plan activist events and projects; get together to discuss feminism, current events, and anything else of interest; plan creative projects like advertising campaigns, videos, stories, spoken word and poetry; and start activist actions on issues that matter to us all!

Peace, Justice and Freedom...
results.name: Radical Feminist Activists

results.description:
Brands are facing a crisis in today's marketplace that very few executives truly appreciate: Customers are overwhelmed by choice and conflicting information; they no longer trust organizations; and they are savvy, active discerners of messaging. 

As EVP marketing and customer experience, I am presently working on transforming a commodity brand in a distrusted industry into an inspiring and adored brand. 

Join me to confidentially share challenges and difficulties, and to discuss possible solutions. 

We will discuss new approaches to understand customers' beliefs and how to create change in the culture and brand of an organization. 

***

Meeting agenda Feb 23rd:

Assisted by Tom Asacker, Business author and brand advisor, we will review in this first meeting the process of getting a brand transformation started by identifying the challenges and possible solutions to create the best possible environment for success. An interactive discussion will allow participants to share their experience.


***ATTENTION

This meet-up is reserved to brand managers, marketers and executives in organizations who are working on the exciting, yet challenging process of their brand transformation and culture change.

We are not accepting, consultants, job seekers and students.

This group is reserved exclusively for people who qualify to the following statements: 

- I search for intellectual challenges 

- I am comfortable with feeling uncomfortable 

- I have the influence to change my organization 

- I am at the VP level or above 

- I am responsible for a budget and drive financial decisions for my brand 

- I am driven to learn and improve who I am as an human being 

- I am passionate about my job 

- I feel frustrated and wish more people would care about their job 

- I am turned on by possibility and Intellectually curious

If you answer yes to the next two questions, unfortunately you are not able to join this meet-up: 

- My leadership won't let us innovate and change the brand. 

- I believe more and bigger sales and marketing programs are the answer to making people change.
results.name: NYC Awakened Brand & Culture Transformation

results.description:
Were you born to immigrant parents?  Were you born in another country but came to the US as a small child?  Are you looking to make friends and socialize with other women who can relate to your unique experiences?  

As children of immigrants, there are ways in which we walk in the world that our American friends don't always relate to.  At times we feel as if we're living in two worlds. We have unique cultural traditions and beliefs, some of which clash with mainstream society.  We may be caregivers for our parents or grandparents.  Perhaps we're supporting family members.  There's also a tremendous amount of pressure for us to "make it" and live the American Dream.  That's a heavy burden.  So let's unwind and have fun!

This is not a support group.  It functions just like any other social group, the only difference is that we all share an immigrant connection.  Together we'll enjoy meals at ethnic restaurants, music/dance/art of various cultures, explore other neighborhoods and enjoy what living in NYC has to offer.  As much as possible, I will plan free or low-cost activities that allow us to talk and connect. Your suggestions are welcome and appreciated.
results.name: New York Women Born to Immigrants

results.description:
From television to the Internet, the widespread adoption of new technology historically requires great, original content fueling adoption. Virtual and Augmented Reality will prove no different, and everything old is new again. I know -- I also run New York's 3D Printing Entrepreneurs, Breakfast with Founders, am a global intellectual property and technology attorney, and the Founder of a 3d printing consultancy, Transcend 3D.

Virtual Reality content lends itself to "first person account" in a way in which preceding technologies never have. It forces the user to look around, and when they do there better be some content to discover. It's a new way of storytelling and it is utterly unexplored. So you must be a Pioneer. Up for it?

New York has long-enjoyed status as a premier city for content creation, from advertising to television and film. Let's not drop the ball, People. Come join the Reality Revolution; Come join VRCC.
